intro: Sehima textilis, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often found in disturbed soils and agricultural areas. Sehima textilis is also known for its potential use in traditional medicine and as a source of fibers.
